description: You stand inside the office of the Thain, the police protectorate of the
great Shire.  The Thain has sworn to protect the Shire from all thieves and
murderers with his life, and so eyes you suspiciously.  A door to the west
leads to the Shiriff Post.
1111.name: Thain's Office

description: You stand in a comfortably well-equipped house, a palace by humble halfling
standards.  On the wall you see a banner which reads "Home Sweet Home".
A solid oak door to the east leads to a pantry while you see a cozy bedroom
to the west.
1135.name: Bag End

description: Through the keyhole you see what looks like a well stocked pantry.
You see a bedroom.  It looks like the beds have recently been slept in.
You see Delving Lane.
You stand on Bywater Road, the busiest street in all of Shiredom.  The road
continues to the east and west.  A large, imposing building lies to the south.
You catch a glimpse of the Brandywine River to the north.
1118.name: Bywater Road

description: To the east you see the entrance to the Shire.
To the west runs Bywater Road.
A large, imposing building lies to the south.  A sign reads 'Shiriff Post'.
All around large trees grow, all different kinds.  They stand tall,
creating a somewhat thick canopy overhead.  Inside the forest, the
sounds of life echo as its habitants go on with their daily lives.  A
small dirt path, probably an animal trail, cuts through the forest
floor.
1187.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: A dark path wanders through the forest floor, into the depths of
the Shire Forest.  Life inside moves about, hidden away from prying
eyes of unwanted guests.  A few birds fly around, and some of the
brush around rustles with the sound of something moving about.
1188.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: A dark path wanders through the forest floor, into the depths of
the Shire Forest.  Life inside moves about, hidden away from prying
eyes of unwanted guests.  A few birds fly around, and some of the
brush around rustles with the sound of something moving about.
1195.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: You stand on Bywater Road, the busiest street in all of Shiredom.  The road
continues to the north and south.  To the east you spy the training grounds for
shiriffs in training.
1112.name: Bywater Road

description: To the north runs Bywater Road.
You stand inside The Shire's Train Station.  Here you see the whole
building is made from a fine wood.  The walls, floors and ceiling are
made from this fine wood, giving the place a nice, but dark look.  To
the north, the Ticket Booth is there.  You see the guy standing behind
the bars, that make up the front of the booth.
1158.name: The Shire Train Station

description: You stand on a solidly built bridge.  As you look down you spy gaily
colored fish swimming with the current of Brandywine River.  The cool water
looks invitingly refreshing and you get a sudden urge to strip and bathe in
the river, but you hear the laughter of women nearby and so resist the urge.
Delving Lane extends to the north while Bywater Road can be seen to the south.
1131.name: Brandywine Bridge

description: You see Delving Lane.
To the south runs Bywater Road.
You are at one end of a dark tunnel.  The tunnel continues to the south
while on the ceiling you can make out a trapdoor.
1156.name: End of a dark tunnel

description: A trapdoor on the ceiling reveals a passageway.
You see a dark tunnel.
All around large trees grow, all different kinds.  They stand tall,
creating a somewhat thick canopy overhead.  Inside the forest, the
sounds of life echo as its habitants go on with their daily lives.  A
small dirt path, probably an animal trail, cuts through the forest
floor.
1184.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: A small wind picks up the surrounding tree canapy, causing the
branches to sway in the wind.  The sound of leaves rubbing leaves
echoes around the forest floor.  A few birds fly away from the area.
1194.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: A small wind picks up the surrounding tree canapy, causing the
branches to sway in the wind.  The sound of leaves rubbing leaves
echoes around the forest floor.  A few birds fly away from the area.
1186.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: You tread through the deep, dark forest on a dimly lit path.  Up ahead you
can hear the faint sounds of a village.
1166.name: The Shire Forest Road

description: You are inside the finest weapons and armour shop in all of Shiredom.  The
shopkeeper proudly displays his fine wares and humbly offers the best daggers
that you have ever laid eyes on.
1107.name: House of Arms

description: The only exit lies to the south.
You stand at the entrance to a watermill.  You hear the bustle of busy
workers and the sound of a creaking mill.  Bywater Road is to the north while
the watermill continues to the south.
1123.name: Entrance to Watermill

description: You see Bywater Road to the north.
A watermill meets your gaze.
You tread through the deep, dark forest on a dimly lit path.  Up ahead you
can hear the faint sounds of a village.
1165.name: The Shire Forest Road

description: You stand in a grassy field--nothing to get too excited about..  Maybe
there is.  The path extends to the west where a faint structure beyond can be
seen.
1130.name: Grassy field

description: You see a grassy field.
All around large trees grow, all different kinds.  They stand tall,
creating a somewhat thick canopy overhead.  Inside the forest, the
sounds of life echo as its habitants go on with their daily lives.  A
small dirt path, probably an animal trail, cuts through the forest
floor.
1196.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: You stand on top of Took Hill, named after the legendary Bandobras Took.
You feel honored to be standing on a hill named after your hero.  From this
vantage point you can see all of shiredom.  You get the feeling that with
one stomp you could eliminate their great city.  You can see the outline of
Westbridge to the far east.  Sounds of joyful celebration are heard from the
fields west of here.  The Brandywine flows by lazily nearby.
1126.name: Took Hill

description: To the east runs Bywater Road.
You see a grassy field to the west.
You are inside a smial, a hole in the ground which serves as the proper
dwelling place for halflings.  As you look around this private abode, you feel
as if you are intruding and so quickly cover your eyes.  The only exit lies
to the west.
1115.name: Smial

description: Bywater Road continues west and south.  A large, imposing building lies
to the east.  Farther to the south, you can see an Inn of some sort.
1109.name: Bend in the road

description: A large, imposing building lies to the east.  A sign reads 'Shiriff Post'.
To the west runs Bywater Road.
To the south runs Bywater Road.
You are standing in the Inn of the Green dragon.  Large paintings of
halflings at work, and halflings at play adorn the walls.  Comfortable
benches and seats line the walls.  A stairway leads down.
1157.name: Inn of the Green Dragon

description: Delving Lane runs north and south in this small borough of the Shire.  A
large, imposing building lies to the east.  You hear the bray of horses from
the west.
1133.name: Delving Lane

description: You see Delving Lane.
A large, imposing building lies to the east.  A sign reads 'Shiriff Post'.
You see a grassy field.
You see Delving Lane.
You are in the Shiriff Post which acts as the nucleus for the three shiriffs
of Delving Lane.  As you examine the shiriffs on duty, you come to realize
that the halflings of the Shire are not to be reckoned with.  You cower with
awe.  The only exit is to the west.
1145.name: Shiriff Post of Delving Lane

description: You see Delving Lane.
A dark path wanders through the forest floor, into the depths of
the Shire Forest.  Life inside moves about, hidden away from prying
eyes of unwanted guests.  A few birds fly around, and some of the
brush around rustles with the sound of something moving about.
1181.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: A small wind picks up the surrounding tree canapy, causing the
branches to sway in the wind.  The sound of leaves rubbing leaves
echoes around the forest floor.  A few birds fly away from the area.
1180.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: You feel your boots sinking into the mud.  Numerous pigs roam about,
oblivious to your company.  A grassy field is to the north while you see
a small path winding to the south.
1139.name: Pig pen

description: You see a grassy field.
Animals of every sort fill the small barn.  You feel the hot breath of
horses and cows on your neck and you feel the sudden need for fresh air.
Other than that, you feel cozy and protected and don't mind staying for a
bit longer.  All the warmth and good vibes remind you of the days when your
mother would hold you in her arms and sing you to sleep.  You find yourself
wanting to cradle all the animals.
1142.name: Barn

description: You see a grassy field.
Delving Lane runs north and south in this small borough of the Shire.  To
the south stands Brandywine Bridge.  The Green Dragon, the undisputed leader
in the art of innkeeping, offers rest and comfort to the east.  You hear the
bray of horses from the west.
1132.name: Delving Lane

description: You see Delving Lane.
The Green Dragon offers food, drink, and above all hospitality for mere gold.
Brandywine Bridge offers safe passage across the tumultuous river.
You stand inside a small underground tunnel.  The ceiling is so low that
you must crouch to avoid hitting your head.  The tunnel continues east and
west.  All you can see is darkness.
1147.name: Dark tunnel

description: You see a dark tunnel.
You see a dark tunnel.
Delving Lane runs north and south in this small borough of the Shire. There
is a small house to the west, nothing to the east, and up ahead you see a round
door which leads to a rather impressive abode.
1134.name: Delving Lane

description: A large, magnificent house meets your steady gaze.  Above the round door a
sign reads 'Bag End'.
You see Delving Lane.
You tread through the deep, dark forest on a dimly lit path.  Up ahead you
can hear the faint sounds of a village.
1167.name: The Shire Forest Road

description: All around large trees grow, all different kinds.  They stand tall,
creating a somewhat thick canopy overhead.  Inside the forest, the
sounds of life echo as its habitants go on with their daily lives.  A
small dirt path, probably an animal trail, cuts through the forest
floor.
1182.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: You stand inside a small underground tunnel.  The ceiling is so low that
you must crouch to avoid hitting your head.  The tunnel continues east and
west.  All you can see is darkness.
1148.name: Dark tunnel

description: You see a dark tunnel.
You see a dark tunnel.
You stand in a damp, dimly lit room.  Mildew clings to the walls and it
appears as if you were the first person to enter the room in ages.  A barely
visible portal in the ground catches your eye.
1125.name: Rear of watermill

description: A watermill meets your gaze.
A hidden portal reveals a passageway down.
You walk on a stony path which leads to a small residence to the west.
From the north you hear the noisy din of pigs.
1140.name: Stony path

description: All around large trees grow, all different kinds.  They stand tall,
creating a somewhat thick canopy overhead.  Inside the forest, the
sounds of life echo as its habitants go on with their daily lives.  A
small dirt path, probably an animal trail, cuts through the forest
floor.
1185.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: You tread through the deep, dark forest on a dimly lit path.  Up ahead you
can hear the faint sounds of a village.
1168.name: The Shire Forest Road

description: A small wind picks up the surrounding tree canapy, causing the
branches to sway in the wind.  The sound of leaves rubbing leaves
echoes around the forest floor.  A few birds fly away from the area.
1174.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: You tread through the deep, dark forest on a dimly lit path.  The forest
here seems less dense than to the south.  Northward you see the faint outline
of a village.
1102.name: The Shire Forest Road

description: The dimly lit path leads to a village.
The dimly lit path leads south through the dense forest.
The sounds of mock battle and feigned death cries fill your ears.  Every
which way you turn you see halfling trainees at the prime of their youth.  A
wizened old battle instructor meets your gaze and asks if he may be of
service.  The only exit lies to the west.
1117.name: Shiriff Training Grounds

description: You stand upon a grassy field.  A bull stands grazing not far away and
out of the corner of your eye you can see him considering you.  The sound
of animals fill the air from the north.  To the south you see a pig pen.
1138.name: Grassy field

description: You see a large barn.
You see Delving Lane.
A rather large pig pen is to the south.
A dark path wanders through the forest floor, into the depths of
the Shire Forest.  Life inside moves about, hidden away from prying
eyes of unwanted guests.  A few birds fly around, and some of the
brush around rustles with the sound of something moving about.
1176.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: You stand in the private bedroom of Bag End.  There are two beds to the
side, neither of which are made.  Portraits of halflings hang on the wall,
and as you gaze upon them you come to the conclusion that the owner of
Bag End comes from a long line of distinguished halflings.  A cozy fire
in the fireplace keeps the room warm and comfortable.
1136.name: Bedroom

description: Through the doorway you see the main room of Bag End.
You stand at an intersection.  The tunnel continues east and west while
to the north you can barely make out a smaller trail.
1149.name: Three way intersection

description: You see a dark tunnel.
You see a dark tunnel.
You see a dark tunnel.
You are inside a smial, a hole in the ground which serves as the proper
dwelling place for halflings.  As you look around this private abode, you feel
as if you are intruding and so quickly cover your eyes.  The only exit lies
to the east.
1114.name: Smial

description: Halfling workers are scattered everywhere, busy at work.  You see the river
to the west and get a compelling urge to grab the nearest worker and to toss
him into the river.  The entrance stands to the north while a door offers
passage to the south.
1124.name: Watermill

description: You see the entrance.
A wooden door leads to the rear of the watermill.
A small wind picks up the surrounding tree canapy, causing the
branches to sway in the wind.  The sound of leaves rubbing leaves
echoes around the forest floor.  A few birds fly away from the area.
1189.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: You stand inside a rather crudely built halfling hole.  The many passageways
and winding paths remind you of a rodent's lair.  The air is musty and damp
and you feel the need for fresh air.
1155.name: Halfling hole

description: You see a dark tunnel.
A dark path wanders through the forest floor, into the depths of
the Shire Forest.  Life inside moves about, hidden away from prying
eyes of unwanted guests.  A few birds fly around, and some of the
brush around rustles with the sound of something moving about.
1177.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: You are in the shiriff Post which acts as the nucleus for the three shiriffs
of the Lower Shire.  As you examine the shiriffs on duty, you come to realize
that the halflings of the Shire are not to be reckoned with.  You cower with
awe.  The only exit is to the east.
1153.name: Shiriff Post of the Lower Shire

description: You see a dark tunnel.
You stand on Bywater Road, the busiest street in all of Shiredom.  The road
continues to the north.  The private residences of Shire inhabitants are to
the east and west while to the south lies the Ivy Bush, second only to the
Green Dragon for its hospitality and service.
1113.name: Bywater Road

description: A dark path wanders through the forest floor, into the depths of
the Shire Forest.  Life inside moves about, hidden away from prying
eyes of unwanted guests.  A few birds fly around, and some of the
brush around rustles with the sound of something moving about.
1193.name: {BA Sm{ball P{Bond{x

description: A dark path wanders through the forest floor, into the depths of
the Shire Forest.  Life inside moves about, hidden away from prying
eyes of unwanted guests.  A few birds fly around, and some of the
brush around rustles with the sound of something moving about.
1197.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: You stand inside a modest home.  You deduce that this is indeed the home
of whomever owns the surrounding lands.  The air is somewhat musty and
the smell reminds you of a stable.  As you look around disdainfully, you
think to yourself that this is more of a shack than a proper residence and
you long for the urban riches of the Shire proper.
1141.name: Gamgee Residence

description: You are in the Ivy Bush, one of the most famous inns in all of Shiredom.
Chic Shire urbanites and seasoned travelers fill the confines of the room
with gay and lively talk.  A jovial innkeeper stops all that he is doing to
await your command.  The only exit lies to the north.
1116.name: Ivy Bush

description: You tread through the deep, dark forest on a dimly lit path.  Up ahead you
can hear the faint sounds of a village.
1163.name: The Shire Forest Road

description: You are in the Shiriff Post which acts as the nucleus for the three shiriffs
of the Bridge.  As you examine the shiriffs on duty, you come to realize that
the halflings of the Shire are not to be reckoned with.  You cower with awe.
The only exit is to the north.
1119.name: Shiriff Post of the Bridge

description: The only exit is to the north.
You stand inside a rather crudely built halfling hole.  The many passageways
and winding paths remind you of a rodent's lair.  The air is musty and damp
and you feel the need for fresh air.
1154.name: Halfling hole

description: You see a dark tunnel.
You are in the Shiriff Post which acts as the nucleus for the three shiriffs
of the Eastern Shire.  As you examine the shiriffs on duty, you come to realize
that the halflings of the Shire are not to be reckoned with.  You cower with
awe.  A door offers passage to the east.
1110.name: Shiriff Post of the Eastern Shire

description: To the west you can see Bywater Road.
A small wind picks up the surrounding tree canapy, causing the
branches to sway in the wind.  The sound of leaves rubbing leaves
echoes around the forest floor.  A few birds fly away from the area.
1198.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: All around large trees grow, all different kinds.  They stand tall,
creating a somewhat thick canopy overhead.  Inside the forest, the
sounds of life echo as its habitants go on with their daily lives.  A
small dirt path, probably an animal trail, cuts through the forest
floor.
1171.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: You tremble with ecstasy as the tempting odors of freshly made pipeweed
bread fill your lungs.  Rumor has it that the pipeweed bread sold here can
restore vitality.  You look around but find no one to take your order.
You then peep over the counter and discover a friendly grocer who is too
short to be seen over the counter.  The only exit is to the north.
1121.name: Grocer's Delight

description: The only exit is to the north.
A dark path wanders through the forest floor, into the depths of
the Shire Forest.  Life inside moves about, hidden away from prying
eyes of unwanted guests.  A few birds fly around, and some of the
brush around rustles with the sound of something moving about.
1173.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: You stand in a grassy field--nothing to get too excited about.  The field
extends toward the south and the west.  To the east you see Took Hill.
1127.name: Northern end of grassy field

description: You tread through the deep, dark forest on a dimly lit path.  Up ahead you
can hear the faint sounds of a village.
1101.name: The Shire Forest Road

description: The dimly lit path leads north through the dense forest.
You tread through the deep, dark forest on a dimly lit path.  Up ahead you
can hear the faint sounds of a village.
1100.name: The Shire Forest Road

description: The dimly lit path leads south through the light forest.
You stand on Bywater Road, the busiest street in all of Shiredom.  The
road continues to the east and west.  To the north, steps lead to a
friendly-looking weaponry/armory while a nursery lies to the south.
1106.name: Bywater Road

description: Steps lead to a friendly looking weaponry and armory.
To the east runs Bywater Road.
To the west runs Bywater Road.
To the south lies Kid'n Keep, the local nursery.
A dark path wanders through the forest floor, into the depths of
the Shire Forest.  Life inside moves about, hidden away from prying
eyes of unwanted guests.  A few birds fly around, and some of the
brush around rustles with the sound of something moving about.
1170.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: Welcome to the Green Dragon, the undisputed leader in the art of
innkeeping.  A rather charming and friendly hostess stands to the side,
ready to offer you food and drink.  While most of the patrons are halfling
locals, you spy an occasional human or two.  As you listen more closely
to the conversations that fill the inn, you hear the tales of great and
seasoned adventurers as well as the usual gossip.  You feel as if you've
found your second home in the Green Dragon.  You see a stairway leading
upwards.
1144.name: Green Dragon

description: You see the reception.
You see Delving Lane.
A small wind picks up the surrounding tree canapy, causing the
branches to sway in the wind.  The sound of leaves rubbing leaves
echoes around the forest floor.  A few birds fly away from the area.
1172.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: You are inside the general store.  All sorts of goodies are stacked on the
many shelves.  Your local friendly shopkeeper is smiling patiently, waiting to
serve you to the best of his abilities.  The only exit is to the south.
1105.name: General Store

description: The only exit lies to the south.
All around large trees grow, all different kinds.  They stand tall,
creating a somewhat thick canopy overhead.  Inside the forest, the
sounds of life echo as its habitants go on with their daily lives.  A
small dirt path, probably an animal trail, cuts through the forest
floor.
1178.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: You stand inside a small underground tunnel.  The ceiling is so low that
you must crouch to avoid hitting your head.  The tunnel continues north and
south.  To the west you see a Shirriff Post while to the east lies a small
home.  All you can see is darkness.
1151.name: Dark tunnel

description: You see a dark tunnel.
You see a halfling hole.
Above a great oak door you see a sign which reads 'Shirriff Post'.
You see a dark tunnel.
You stand inside a small underground tunnel.  The ceiling is so low that
you must crouch to avoid hitting your head.  The tunnel continues north and
south.  To the west lies a small home.  All you can see is darkness.
1152.name: Dark tunnel

description: You see a dark tunnel.
You see a halfling hole.
You see a dark tunnel.
You are inside Kid'n'Keep, the convenient one-stop nursery that maintains
the youth of the Shire.  Toddlers run every which way while their nursemaids
sigh in exasperation.  The only exit lies to the north.
1108.name: Kid'n Keep

description: The only exit lies to the north.
You stand in the center of a grassy field.  A great birthday party
appears to be taking place.  Great tables of food are spread out and a young
halfling beauty offers you welcome.  You are enticed by her generousity and
suggestive winks.  The grassy field goes east and west here.
1128.name: Grassy field

description: A small hill to the east blocks your view.
You see a grassy field.
You see a grassy field.
You stand on Bywater Road, the busiest street in all of Shiredom.  The road
continues to the east and west while to the north lies the general store.
1104.name: Bywater Road

description: The general store lies to the north.
To the east runs Bywater Road.
To the west you see the entrance to the Shire.
You stand inside a small underground tunnel.  The ceiling is so low that
you must crouch to avoid hitting your head.  You see light from a small
hole in the ceiling while to the east you see nothing but darkness.
1146.name: Dark tunnel

description: You see a dark tunnel.
You see a portal which leads to a small room.
A dark path wanders through the forest floor, into the depths of
the Shire Forest.  Life inside moves about, hidden away from prying
eyes of unwanted guests.  A few birds fly around, and some of the
brush around rustles with the sound of something moving about.
1179.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: All around large trees grow, all different kinds.  They stand tall,
creating a somewhat thick canopy overhead.  Inside the forest, the
sounds of life echo as its habitants go on with their daily lives.  A
small dirt path, probably an animal trail, cuts through the forest
floor.
1175.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: A dark path wanders through the forest floor, into the depths of
the Shire Forest.  Life inside moves about, hidden away from prying
eyes of unwanted guests.  A few birds fly around, and some of the
brush around rustles with the sound of something moving about.
1191.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: You stand in a grassy field--nothing to get too excited about.  The field
extends toward the north and the west.  To the east you see Took Hill.
1129.name: Southern end of grassy field

description: You see a grassy field.
You tread through the deep, dark forest on a dimly lit path.  Up ahead you
can hear the faint sounds of a village.
1164.name: The Shire Forest Road

description: You stand on Bywater Road, the busiest street in all of Shiredom.  The road
continues to the east.  A small hill lies to the west while you can see a
watermill to the far south.  You catch a glimpse of the Brandywine River to
the north.
1122.name: Bywater Road

description: To the east runs Bywater Road.
A small hill to the west blocks your view.
An entrance to the watermill lies to the south.
You are inside the pantry.  Shelves filled with food and drink surround
you on all sides.  You wonder why a halfling would need so much to eat.
The presence of something unseen chills you to your bones.  On the floor
you spy a trapdoor.
1137.name: Pantry

description: Beyond the door you see the main room of Bag End.
It's anyone's guess as to where the trapdoor leads.
All around large trees grow, all different kinds.  They stand tall,
creating a somewhat thick canopy overhead.  Inside the forest, the
sounds of life echo as its habitants go on with their daily lives.  A
small dirt path, probably an animal trail, cuts through the forest
floor.
1192.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: You stand on the depot of Shire.  You see a single railway going to
the east, towards Westbridge and Torregiano.  The platform here is filled
with people waiting to board the trains, some sitting on the benches against
the wall of the station.  You are now in Shire.
1159.name: The Shire Depot

description: You stand at the end of a dark tunnel.  The underground tunnel continues
to the west.  From a trapdoor in the ceiling you can hear the din of
adventurers.
1150.name: End of a dark tunnel

description: You hear the din of adventurers.
You see a dark tunnel.
You stand on Bywater Road, the busiest street in all of Shiredom.  The road
continues to the east and west.  To the south you spy the Grocer's Delight,
the premium grocer's shop in all the realm while to the north lies Brandywine
Bridge.
1120.name: Bywater Road

description: Brandywine Bridge offers safe passage across the tumultuous river.
To the east runs Bywater Road.
To the west runs Bywater Road.
You see the Grocer's Delight to the south.
A small wind picks up the surrounding tree canapy, causing the
branches to sway in the wind.  The sound of leaves rubbing leaves
echoes around the forest floor.  A few birds fly away from the area.
1183.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description: You stand inside a rather crowded chicken coop.  The cackle of hens fill
the air.  The only exit is to the east.
1143.name: Chicken coop

description: You stand at the entrance to the Shire.  You see halflings, no more than
wee tall, every which way you look. Bywater Road leads east and west.
1103.name: Entrance to the Shire

description: To the east runs Bywater Road.
To the west runs Bywater Road.
To the south you see a dimly lit path which leads to a dense forest.
All around large trees grow, all different kinds.  They stand tall,
creating a somewhat thick canopy overhead.  Inside the forest, the
sounds of life echo as its habitants go on with their daily lives.  A
small dirt path, probably an animal trail, cuts through the forest
floor.
1190.name: {gT{Gh{ge {gS{Ghir{ge {gF{Gores{gt{x

description:
A cabbit is a creature that has the face of a cat, and a body
and ears like a rabbit.  These creatures are only found in the
Eastern Great Realms.
1164.room_name: A rabbit like cat creature is perched on a tree branch.
1164.name: The Cabbit~

1158.room_name: The Shire Train Station Ticket Seller stands here.
1158.name: The Shire Ticket Seller~

1159.room_name: The Shire Ticket Collector stands here collecting tickets.
1159.name: The Shire Ticket Collector~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK
M GIVE 16 trptckt~
M GIVE 15 shireticket~
M GRALL 14 100~
M GIVE 13 trtrggnokt~
M GIVE 12 trnttckt~
M GIVE 11 trstbwtckt~
M GIVE 10 trwstbrdtckt~

description:
A large deer wanders around, keeping a close eye on
the surrounding around itself.
1160.room_name: A large deer wanders around the forest.
1160.name: The Deer~

description:
A large black beaver wanders around the forest floor,
mainly looking for a tree to eat or sharpen its teeth
on.
1161.room_name: A black beaver works its teeth on a nearby tree.
1161.name: The Beaver~

description:
A skunk wanders around the forest floor, looking for food.  Most
people do not know that a skunk only sprays as a last resort.  If
it thumps at you, back off.
1162.room_name: A black and white weasel like creature wanders around sniffing.
1162.name: The Skunk~

description:
A long slender ferret runs around the forest floor.  Strangely
enough, ferrets are not known to be wild.  Beware, they love
shiney, noisey objects.
1163.room_name: A brown weasel like creature scurries beneath the brush.
1163.name: The Ferret~

description:
The Elven Wizard looks at you in a solemn sort of way.  His gaze seems to
penetrate through your innermost being.  He is wearing a silvery cloak
and holding a multi-colored staff.  Although he appears to be older
than the oldest man, he seems to have an inner strength which most mortals
cannot overcome.
1100.room_name: An Elven Wizard is here, creating fireworks for the festivities.
1100.name: the Elven Wizard~

description:
The Ring Keeper is a rather big but short halfling.  His short stature and
bulbous nose belie his true nature.  An elven sword that glows with a blue
light hangs from his belt, and on his finger you see the One Ring.  Although
usually a halfling of peace, he will fight you to the death if you attempt
to take away that which belongs to him.
1101.room_name: The Keeper of the Ring is here, guarding his treasure jealously.
1101.name: the Keeper of the Ring~

description:
Farmer Gamgee is a short, stout halfling of thirty years.  His skin has
been tanned from working the fields night and day.  He's quite a jolly
chap, always ready to befriend an injured bunny rabbit.
1102.room_name: Farmer Gamgee sniffs the air, wondering if harvest time is near.
1102.name: Farmer Gamgee~

description:
The toddler is dressed in nothing but his birthday suit.  He crawls about
for he hasn't learned to walk yet.  He peers up at you and asks "da da?"
1103.room_name: A toddler crawls about, looking for something to chew on.
1103.name: a toddler~

description:
The nursemaid looks rather tired and worn out.  Taking care of so many
toddlers for too long has evidently taken its toll.  She looks to you and
in her eyes you can see her longing for a better life.
1104.room_name: A nursemaid wanders about, trying to keep track of all the toddlers.
1104.name: a nursemaid~

description:
The cow looks like it hasn't been milked in quite some time.  Although she
is past her prime, you see that she still has a lot of years left, and that
if provoked, her rear kick can be quite deadly.
1105.room_name: A cow is here, chewing her cud.
1105.name: a cow~

description:
The pig appears quite happy to be a pig.  He is oblivious to your presence
and cares only for the care-free life that he leads.  It is enormously fat
and consequently cannot move around very quickly.
1106.room_name: A pig wallows in the mud and oinks in contentment.
1106.name: a pig~

description: The chicken is bright and healthy.  She has no weapons but her beak.
1107.room_name: A chicken sits on her nest.
1107.name: a chicken~

description:
The bull is in top condition.  He looks like quite a fighter, nothing to be
reckoned with.  With his horns and his hooves he can attack just about
anything.
1108.room_name: A bull scratches at the ground and lowers his head.
1108.name: a bull~

description: The horse looks at you and turns away.  You can tell that it is afraid of you.
1109.room_name: A horse becomes frightened by your presence.
1109.name: a horse~

description:
The shiriff is over waist high, quite tall for a halfling.  His eyes are
ever roaming, looking for signs of trouble from riff-raff like you.  In
his belt is a thin dagger, and on his body he wears a suit of leather armor.
This is one halfling you don't want to mess with.
1110.room_name: A shiriff of the Shire looks for signs of trouble.
1110.name: a shiriff~

description:
The shiriff is over waist high, quite tall for a halfling.  His eyes are
ever roaming, looking for signs of trouble from riff raff like you.  In
his belt is a thin dagger, and on his body he wears a suit of leather armor.
This is one halfling you don't want to mess with.
1111.room_name: A shiriff of the Shire looks for signs of trouble.
1111.name: a shiriff~

description:
A personable yet serious halfling, the Thain looks at you and yells a
deep 'Hullo'.  He walks about comfortably, secure in the knowledge that
as long as he's in office, the Shire will always remain a safe haven for
Shire folk.
1112.room_name: The Thain commands respect from all Shire folk.
1112.name: the Thain~

description:
The Innkeeper is a jolly old halfling who spends his days eavesdropping on
local gossip.  In his younger days, he was quite a seasoned traveller.
1113.room_name: The Innkeeper stands here awaiting your order.
1113.name: the Innkeeper~

description:
The Miller is an impatient young halfling, always trying to command more
respect from his workers than he can get.  He looks like the type of person
who deserves a spanking but never got one.
1114.room_name: The Miller is here, overseeing his busy mill workers.
1114.name: the Miller~

description:
The mill worker is in fine shape from the hard labor that he does at the
mill.  He doesn't notice your presence, but he looks like he could break you
in two without thinking about it.
1115.room_name: The mill worker runs to and fro.
1115.name: the mill worker~

description:
The tall elven warrior is light and fair-skinned.  The expression that he wears
on his countenance is solemn and tragic.  He cares not for this world any
longer and wearies of it.
1116.room_name: The elven warrior watches you solemnly.
1116.name: the elven warrior~

description:
Grim and cold, the dwarven prince is quite strong and bulky, even for the
dwarves of his land.  His glowing eyes peer out of his bushy face and stare
beyond your gaze.
1117.room_name: The dwarven prince sits here patiently for the return of his king.
1117.name: the dwarven prince~

description:
The shopkeeper will fight like a madman to protect his store from riff-raff
like you.
1118.room_name: The shopkeeper smiles and patiently waits for you to buy something.
1118.name: the shopkeeper~

description:
The grocer is a large, jovial halfling who knows how to enjoy his pipeweed.
However, he also knows that it's worth protecting and so will do everything
in his power to prevent riff-raff like you from stealing it.
1119.room_name: The grocer offers you the finest breads in all the land.
1119.name: the grocer~

description:
The blacksmith is a lean and mean fighting machine.  His knowledge of weapons
and armour would certainly help him in any fight against riff-raff like you.
1120.room_name: The blacksmith bids you welcome to his humble store.
1120.name: the blacksmith~

description: The battle master is a wizened fighter, with many scars to prove his worth.
1121.room_name: The battle master offers you the services of his fine trainees.
1121.name: the battle master~

description:
The halfling youth is not yet quite in the prime of his youth.  He's knee
high and you get the sudden urge to step on him.
1122.room_name: A halfling youth stands here, waiting for nothing in particular.
1122.name: a halfling youth~

description:
The seasoned adventurer has seen his share of glory days.  Although he is
past his prime, he still looks like he could put up more than his share of
a good fight.
1123.room_name: A seasoned adventurer sits here, telling tales of fame and fortune.
1123.name: a seasoned adventurer~

description:
The gossip is all talk and no action.  You're transfixed by her ability to
talk so much so quickly.
1124.room_name: A local gossip asks you, "Have you heard the latest?"
1124.name: a local gossip~

description:
She is the most beautiful creature you've seen in quite some time.  As you
stare at her, thoughts of all else vanish.  You get the sudden urge to grovel
at her feet, hoping she'll take you in like a lost puppy.  You wouldn't dare
harm a hair on her precious little head.
1125.room_name: A halfling beauty stares dreamily into your eyes.
1125.name: a halfling beauty~

description:
The trainee smiles smugly, aware of your interest in him.  He's a little
fresh, but his enthusiasm and desire to please more than make up for what
he lacks in skill.
1126.room_name: A trainee screams a death cry as he delivers the fatal blow to a dummy.
1126.name: a trainee~

description:
The urbanite seems very much at home in his surroundings.  His clothes are
all of the latest fashions and his manners impeccable.  He offers you some
coins if you'd be so good as to order a drink for him.
1127.room_name: A chic urbanite sits here, enjoying his class status.
1127.name: a chic urbanite~

description: The country bumpkin snores noisily.
1128.room_name: A country bumpkin dreams of pipeweed and its many uses.
1128.name: a country bumpkin~

description:
The Innkeeper is a jolly old halfling who spends his days eavesdropping on
local gossip.  In his younger days, he was quite a seasoned traveller.
1130.room_name: The Innkeeper stands here awaiting your order.
1130.name: the Innkeeper~

description: He is a very professional looking type.
1131.room_name: The receptionist sits here, signing forms.
1131.name: the receptionist~

description:
The shiriff is over waist high, quite tall for a halfling.
He looks at you, smiles and asks you if you have seen a halfling youth
somewhere outside the shire.
1132.room_name: A shiriff of the Shire looks for the lost halfling youth.
1132.name: a shiriff~
